description: accept +‎ -er; in the sense “respecter,” from Middle French accepteur.

entries.meaning: A person who accepts; a taker.
examples: There is no benefyte so perfect, whiche enuy can not nip: nor no benefite so skant, whiche a good accepter may not inlarge.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A respecter; one who views others with partiality.
examples: And Petre openyde his mouth, and seide, In trewthe Y haue foundun, that God is no acceptor of persoones;

entries.meaning: (law) An acceptor; one who accepts an order or a bill of exchange.
